dt: {bc}a coherent whole characterized as a collection, sequence, or progression of values or elements varying by minute degrees

dt.t: "good" and "bad" … stand at opposite ends of a {wi}continuum{/wi} instead of describing the two halves of a line

dt: {bc}the set of {d_link|real numbers|real number} including both the {d_link|rationals|rational number} and the {d_link|irrationals|irrational number}
{bc}a compact set which cannot be separated into two sets neither of which contains a limit point of the other

et: borrowed from Medieval Latin, noun derivative from neuter of Latin {it}continuus{/it} {et_link|continuous|continuous}
shortdef: a coherent whole characterized as a collection, sequence, or progression of values or elements varying by minute degrees
the set of real numbers including both the rationals and the irrationals; broadly : a compact set which cannot be separated into two sets neither of which contains a limit point of the other

dt: {bc}a system of one temporal and three spatial coordinates by which any physical object or event can be located
{bc}the whole or a portion of physical reality determinable by a usually four-dimensional coordinate system
{bc}the properties characteristic of such an order

shortdef: a system of one temporal and three spatial coordinates by which any physical object or event can be located —called also space-time continuum
the whole or a portion of physical reality determinable by a usually four-dimensional coordinate system; also : the properties characteristic of such an order
